means: 在（硬物）上雕刻（字，画等）( engrave的过去式和过去分词 )
将某事物深深印在（记忆或头脑中）

sentence.Network_en: I'm having "John Law" engraved on the cap.
The silver cup was engraved with his name.
It was prettily engraved with flowers on the back.
sentence.Network_cn: 此件雕刻精美,背面有花饰图案.

entry.tran: 铭记于心的；刻在脑海中的
entry.def: If you say that something is engraved on your mind or memory or on your heart, you are emphasizing that you will never forget it, because it has made a very strong impression on you.

example.ex: Her image is engraved upon my heart...
example.tran: 她的形象铭刻在我心中。

example.ex: The drowning at Chappaquiddick, now more than 20 years ago, is still engraved in the collective memory of America.
example.tran: 直至今日，二十几年前的查帕奎迪克溺亡事件仍然铭记在全体美国人心中。

means.word_mean: 1. cut or impressed into a surface;

auth_sentence.content: The lid is engraved with the center's logo.
auth_sentence.res_content: The lid is engraved with the center's logo.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The lid is engraved with the center's logo.

auth_sentence.content: He engraved on it, Don't be discourage.
auth_sentence.res_content: He engraved on it, Don't be discourage.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He engraved on it, Don't be discourage.

auth_sentence.content: Thinking about getting the line engraved behind home plate.
auth_sentence.res_content: Thinking about getting the line engraved behind home plate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Thinking about getting the line engraved behind home plate.
